lead_paragraph: Thousands of demonstrators swarmed a steel factory in Ha Tinh Province over the weekend, echoing the street protests in the country’s major cities in April.

byline.contributor: Chau Doan contributed reporting from Hanoi, Vietnam, and Richard C. Paddock from Manila.

headline.print_headline: Outrage Over Fish Killed by Chemicals in Vietnam Simmers 6 Months Later
headline.main: Outrage Over Fish Kill in Vietnam Simmers 6 Months Later

snippet: Thousands of demonstrators swarmed a steel factory in Ha Tinh Province over the weekend, echoing the street protests in the country’s major cities in April....
abstract: Demonstrators rally at Formosa Steel company in Vietnam, demanding reparations six months after Taiwanese factory leaked chemicals in South China Sea that killed tons of fish and ravaged fishing communities in area; continued public outrage over environmental disaster is illuminating role of Vietnamese government in obscuring facts about cause of fish kill, seen by some as one of country's worst environmental catastrophes in recent history.
